subject: Re: JUnit automatically
msgSnippet: Dear JUnit group members, Someone not related to Agitar (my company and the makers of Agitator) started the JUnit automatically thread.  I originally replied
messageBody:
Dear JUnit group members,

Someone not related to Agitar (my company and the makers of
Agitator) started the "JUnit automatically" thread. I originally
replied to avoid misconceptions about our product, but I don't
believe that this is the right group to discuss Agitator or software
agitation in general.

This is a JUnit group and Agitator does not generate "JUnit
automatically" as the original posting incorrectly suggested.
Agitator does not generate JUnit at all - it uses a different
approach and complementary approach to unit testing. Also, unlike
JUnit, it's a commercial product (i.e. not free.)

I am a big fan/user/promoter of JUnit, and I believe this group will
be best served if we stick to topics that are more directly related
to JUnit and JUnit-based technology.

So, again, it does not sound to me like this is the right group to
ask or answer questions about Agitator, and I will refrain from
doing so (although it's really hard to see your "baby" mis-
represented or mis-understood :-)).

Thanks,

Alberto
